root: ^Pride was my wilderness, and the demon that led me there was fear ~ Margaret Laurence

chapter_one_start: ^You awaken with an uneasy feeling, as though unseen eyes are upon you. For several minutes, you sit up, straining your ears to listen. The room is quiet; you can barely hear the tiny rustle of wind outside. A common person might dismiss the sensation and return to slumber, but you are no normal person.

^As a Keeper, not just any ordinary one, but a spell-casting Keeper, you’ve learned to trust your instincts. Recent monster attacks in the town have only heightened your vigilance. You answer the call of duty as you discard your sleeping attire and change into a robe more suited for battle. Your reach for your trusted weapon…

c-0: ^The great sword's weight feels right in your hands, its emerald flames cast shadows across the walls. The weapon has served you well in countless battles.
c-1: ^You twirl the daggers experimentally; their balance is perfect. A deadly extension of your will.
c-2: ^The staff hums when you grab it, its arcane currents connecting with your thoughts. The energy contained within it feels alive, eager to be unleashed.
c-3: ^You check the tension of the crossbow string. Its mechanism clicks into place satisfyingly. In your hands, it never misses.
c-4: ^The axes hang heavy and reassuring as you hold them. The runes on the blades glow with power.

perimeter_walk: ^You step out of your residence, a small building. It's not as fanciful as the apartments you are used to while growing up in the Order sanctuary, but it's been your home for a while now. The moon hangs high in the night sky, its pale light bathing the world in a spectral glow. Shadows stretch long and deep across the streets. There had been a heavy rain the previous night, which had formed several water puddles that reflected under the moonlight. You pause by one of such puddles, seeing an image of yourself in its surface. You run your hand across your…
^...blonde hair, catching the moonlight like gold.
^...red hair, a contrast to the cool, pale moonlight.
eye_color_scene: ^The forest is just ahead of you, its tall trees forming a wall of shadow. There is a feeling in the air that you can't quite place your hand on. You hear the occasional whisper of leaves, stirred by an unseen breeze. You scan the treeline, seeking the source of your unease.
^For normal humans, the darkness would be a wall, blinding. But you are no ordinary human. Your mutated eyes allow you to see through the darkness, rendering every detail sharp and clear.

^For a while, you see nothing out of the ordinary. You are about to turn away, dismissing the forest as empty, when something catches your eye. Far to the west, almost perfectly hidden behind a massive oak tree, a pair of yellowish eyes is staring at you, unblinking.
^You meet the gaze with your own…
^...green eyes, sharp and vibrant, full of life.
^...golden eyes, glowing like a dying fire.
